meta_description: DISCOVER NATURE HERE Plant Conservatory Home to West Virginia’s only plant conservatory, our mission to cultivate the appreciation of nature really blooms inside the museum among the species of hundreds of beautiful, agricultural, and exotic plants. Learn More Hiking Trails Our six hiking trails are well-marked and maintained, covering over 40 acres of woodland hillside […]

# CONTACT US

## ART, PROGRAMS, EVENTS AND MORE

**2033 McCoy Road | Huntington, WV**

**[Get Directions](http://web.archive.org/web/20250503225544/https://www.google.com/maps/dir/''/2033+McCoy+Rd,+Huntington,+WV+25701/)**

Phone: (304) 529-2701

HMA is fully accessible in compliance with current ADA standards.

**Hours**

 _Closed to the public on Mondays_ __

Tuesday | 10 am to 8 pm  
(Free general admission on Tuesdays)

Wednesday through Saturday | 10 am to 5 pm

Sunday | 12 pm to 5 pm

**Admission**

HMA charges $5 general admission per adult. Admission is free to children younger than 18.

HMA Members will be admitted free and Bauhaus School Members may bring guests free of charge.

Admission is also free to active-duty military personnel and their immediate families and veterans and their immediate families.

collections_text:
EXPLORE THE HUNTINGTON MUSEUM OF ART!  Photo by Sa-Rai Robinette [See All Current Exhibits ](http://web.archive.org/web/20251221075305/https://hmoa.org/current-exhibitions/) The Huntington Museum of Art is located at 2033 McCoy Road in Huntington, W.Va.  
  
HMA hours are 10 a.m. to 8 p.m. Tuesdays; 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Wednesdays through Saturdays; and noon to 5 p.m. Sundays. HMA is closed to the public on Mondays.  
  
Free Tuesdays at HMA are generously presented by the City of Huntington Mayor’s Council for the Arts.  
DECORATIVE ARTS GALLERY  This collection is part of the HMA permanent collection. [See All Current Exhibits ](http://web.archive.org/web/20251221075305/https://hmoa.org/current-exhibitions/) Discover the brilliance of glass artistry at the Huntington Museum of Art, where the Decorative Arts Gallery showcases stunning pieces from the Ohio Valley and beyond. From Pilgrim Cameo Glass to Blenko’s vibrant designs, this collection celebrates craftsmanship and creativity across generations.  HERMAN P. DEAN ANTIQUE FIREARMS COLLECTION  This collection is part of the HMA permanent collection. [See All Current Exhibits ](http://web.archive.org/web/20251221075305/https://hmoa.org/current-exhibitions/) Step into history at the Huntington Museum of Art with the Herman P. Dean Firearms Collection, showcasing centuries of craftsmanship and innovation. This exhibit highlights the evolution of firearms, with a special focus on the American frontier and the artisans who shaped ...
